roleset.name: to free from dirt
roleset.note: CLEAN-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls clear-10.3-1, preparing-26.3-2, other_cos-45.4. (from clean.01-v)

example.name: passive
example.text: Bias 's coach , Lefty Driesell , ordered [the room in which Bias died]-3 to be cleaned [*-3]before the police could arrive ( the order was n't carried out ) , and the school 's athletics director issued false information about the academic standing of Bias and other players .

example.name: all arguments
example.text: A Mint official says [the agency]-1 offered [*-1]to clean the coins for its `` bare-bones '' cost of $ 17,000 [*U*] plus certain other expenses .
example.arg: for its `` bare-bones '' cost of $ 17,000 [*U*] plus certain other expenses

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: His cleaning the kitchen before cooking marinara sauce was a wasted effort.

roleset.name: free from impurities, contraband, deviations
roleset.note: CLEAN-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6, relation to clean-v.01. (from clean.01-j)

example.name: arg1
example.text: Officials themselves must always bear in mind the belief in *PRO* " being honest and clean and respecting justice " ; only then will they not be corrupted .

example.name: both args
example.text: Priest's file was clean of allegations.

example.name: both args
example.text: Amy Winehouse was clean of drugs when she died...

example.name: arg1
example.text: If she was dirty, she avoided touching anything in the house that-1 [*-1] was clean.

roleset.name: to make clean or orderly, clean_up
roleset.note: CLEAN_UP-V NOTES: See VNcls clear-10.3-1, preparing-26.3-2, other_cos-45.4 (from clean.02-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Using Gnu-Emacs , the spy could substitute a bogus `` atrun '' program for the one that-132 [*T*-132] routinely cleans up the Unix system every five minutes .

The 1989 deficit would have been nearly $ 10 billion larger had [the government]-2 been able to spend as much as Congress intended on *PRO*-2 cleaning up the thrift industry before the year ended on Sept. 30 .

roleset.name: to empty from
roleset.note: CLEAN_OUT-V NOTES: See VNcls clear-10.3-1, preparing-26.3-2, other_cos-45.4. (from clean.03-v)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*-1] Laboring in blue and gray overalls , they-1 are supposed [*-1]-1 to concentrate on [*]-1 cleaning out crevices , and not strain their eyes [*-2] looking for diamonds .
